snippet: The world of online games has long been characterized by name-calling and trash talk, especially directed against women, but some recent episodes have prompted calls for change.
abstract: World of online video games has long been characterized by name-calling and trash talk, especially directed against women, but the severity of some episodes of sexual harassment have prompted public calls for change; executives in the $25 billion-a-year industry are taking note.
lead_paragraph: The world of online games has long been characterized by name-calling and trash talk, especially directed against women, but some recent episodes have prompted calls for change.

headline.seo: Sexual Harassment in Online Gaming Stirs Anger
headline.main: In Virtual Play, Sex Harassment Is All Too Real
headline.print_headline: In Virtual Play, Sex Harassment Is All Too Real
